data.title: Gannon Competitive Cheer Program Announces 2014 Recruiting Class
data.meta_description: ERIE, Pa. - Gannon head competitive cheer coach Meghan Foran has announced the addition of 20 student-athletes to the program. All 20 have agreed to continue their
data.text:
ERIE, Pa. â€“ Gannon head competitive cheer coach Meghan Foran has announced the addition of 20 student-athletes to the program. All 20 have agreed to continue their academic and athletic careers at Gannon in the fall of 2014.

The 2014 recruiting class includes Jessica Cottone (Laurys Station, Pa./Parkland), Samantha Couse (Erie, Pa./Iroquois), Alecia DiMarzio (Ellsworth, Pa./Bentworth), Rachel Dorsey (Cheektowaga, N.Y./West Seneca East), Cassandra Gaglianese (Oriskany, N.Y./Oriskany), Haley Galloway (Collins, N.Y./Immaculata Academy), Kellsie Giordano (Brooktondale, N.Y./Candor), Ella Greggo (Bangor, Pa./Pius X), Jenna Hoffman (Ridgway, Pa./Ridgeway), Lindsay Jensen (Hamburg, N.Y./Hamburg), Kelli Kallenborn (Elmira, N.Y./Horseheads), Amanda MacNeil (Mattydale, N.Y./Bishop Grimes), Madison Mays (Easton, Pa./Wilson), Mariesa Pappaterra (Freedom, Pa./Seneca Valley), Kirsten Payne (Greensburg, Pa./Hempfield Area), Meagen Prindle (Erie, Pa./Harbor Creek), Molly Reuther (Livonia, N.Y./Livonia), Victoria Ryan (Collegeville, Pa./Spring-Ford), Jocelyn Strohm (Cheektowaga, N.Y./Maryvale) and Kailyn Wisor (Harborcreek, Pa./Harbor Creek).

Gannon returns 10 of 13 student-athletes from its inaugural team that advanced to the finals of the National Cheerleaders Association (NCA) Collegiate National Championships in Daytona Beach, Florida last April. The Lady Knights eventually concluded their inaugural campaign eighth in the nation.

The 10 returners include JoAnne Aiello (Saint Mary's, Pa./Elk County Catholic), Angelina Grandinetti (Fayetteville, N.Y./Fayetteville-Manlius), Hannah Kovach (Windber, Pa./Bishop McCort), Shelby Malone (Farmington, Mich./Farmington), Danielle Munsee (Corry, Pa./Corry Area), Katie Pearson (Saint Mary's, Pa./Elk County Catholic), Kristina Cronin (Fairview, Pa./Fairview), Kerri Makay (Girard, Pa./Girard), Samantha Marzka (Slippery Rock, Pa./Slippery Rock) and Shannon Todd (Pittsburgh, Pa./Brentwood).

"I am so excited for these 20 talented young women to join our program," said Foran. "They come from a wide range of backgrounds in high school cheer, all-star cheer, gymnastics, dance and other sports. The class brings great skills and experience to our team. With a very strong group of returning student-athletes from last season, we look forward to building on our accomplishments from 2013-14 and continuing our program's growth this year."

A complete bio for each incoming student-athlete can be found below.

2014 Competitive Cheer Recruiting Class

Alphabetical Order

Jessica Cottone

Laurys Station, Pa. | Parkland High School

Expected major: Early Childhood Education

Cheered for head coach Sami Jo Crivellaro at Parkland (Pa.) High School

Earned three letters

Was a two-sport athlete, letting once with the varsity track and field team

Helped Parkland advance to the semifinals of the PIAA State Cheer Competition

Received the Sportsmanship Award at the UCA Camp

Was a member of the honor roll

Named a Star Student

Is the daughter of Deborah and Paul

Has two sisters

Samantha Couse

Erie, Pa. | Iroquois High School

Expected major: Early Childhood/Special Education

Cheered for head coach Kerrie Grande at Iroquois (Pa.) High School

Named Most Dedicated Cheerleader as a sophomore and junior

Selected Most Spirited Cheerleader as a senior

Earned seven varsity cheer letters

Was a two-sport athlete, lettering three times with the varsity track and field team

Named to the honor roll all four years

Was a member of the National Honor Society as a junior and senior

Named to the National Society of High School Scholars

Received the Model United Nations Scholarship

Is the daughter of Tracy and Kevin

Has one sister

Alecia DiMarzio

Ellsworth, Pa. | Bentworth High School

Expected major: Nutrition and Human Performance

Attended Bentworth (Pa.) High School

Rachel Dorsey

Cheektowaga, N.Y. | West Seneca East High School

Expected major: Psychology

Cheered for head coaches Kristen and J.P. Prime at West Seneca East (N.Y.) High School

Was a member of the merit roll

Named Student of the Month

Cassandra Gaglianese

Oriskany, N.Y. | Oriskany High School

Expected major: Math

Served as a team captain all four years

Was a two-time Top Gun Dancer

Named a Top All-American

Selected Oriskany Central School's Athlete of the Week

Named the Varsity Club's Freshman of the Year

Was part of a team that finished runner-up at the state championships

Helped Oriskany win two Center State Conference championships and six Section III titles

Was a two-sport athlete, serving as a team captain for softball

Named Most Improved Player for the varsity softball team

Was a member of the high honor roll

Named Spanish Club President

Produced the highest average in Spanish

Was a member of the National Honor Society

Is the daughter of Adelle and Mickey

Has one brother

Expected major: Nursing

Was a two-sport athlete, helping the Immaculata track and field team win the All-Catholic Championship twice

Is the daughter of Barb and Bill

Expected major: Legal Studies

Has one sister

Expected major: Undecided

Named Best Flyer and Most Valuable Player

Received the Stunting and Coach's Awards

Received honors for best all-around cheerleader, best jumps, best dance, best tumbling, leadership and best tosses

Earned the United States Achievement and Top Gun Awards

Earned a spot on the NCA staff

Has been a gymnast and competitive cheerleader for 10 years, advancing to level five

Won seven national championships, one international title and one All-Levels championship

Competed in back-to-back World Championships

Was a member of the Pro-Life Club, Students Against Drunk Driving (SADD) Committee, Prom Committee and Queens Court for Church Celebration

Expected major: Physician Assistant

Was a member of the National Honor Society
